describe

Describe program that shows key statistic metrics for a dataset

Calculates statistic metrics and displays them (like pd.describe())

Parameters

df_data – pd.dataframe with a data set

Reads hogwarts dataset to a dataframe :return: dataframe with hogwarts dataset

maths

Math module with essential maths functions

maths.functions.count_v(data: list) → float[source]

Counts not NaN values in a dataset

Parameters

data – list of values

Returns

float counting not NaN values

maths.functions.drop_na(datalist: list) → list[source]

Drops not number values from a dataset

Parameters

datalist – list of values

Returns

list of not NaN values

maths.functions.is_nan(num) → bool[source]

Checks whether value is NaN

Parameters

num – value to check

Returns

bool

maths.functions.kurtosis_42(dataset: list) → float[source]

Excess kurtosis describes the height of the tails of a distribution rather than the extremity of the length of the tails. Excess kurtosis means that the distribution has a high frequency of data outliers. Equivalent to bias=False, Fisher=True in scipy.stats.kurtosis

Parameters

dataset – list of data

Returns

kurtosis

maths.functions.max_val(datalist: list) → float[source]

Finds the maximum value for a list of values

Parameters

datalist (list) – list of values

Returns

max value

Return type

float

maths.functions.mean(data: list) → float[source]

The mean of a data set is the sum of all of the data divided by the size. The mean is also known as the average.

Parameters

data – list of values

Returns

mean value

maths.functions.min_val(datalist: list) → float[source]

Finds the minimum value for a list of values

Parameters

datalist (list) – list of values

Returns

min value

Return type

float

maths.functions.mode_42(dataset: list) → float[source]

The mode is the value or values that occur most frequently in the data set. A data set can have more than one mode, and it can also have no mode.

Parameters

dataset –

Returns

maths.functions.percentile(percent: int, dataset: list) → float[source]

Uses the linear interpolation (as default numpy percentile)

Parameters

  • percent – required percentile to calculate

  • dataset – list of data

Returns

percentile

maths.functions.quartile_25(dataset: list) → float[source]

Calculates 25 quartile (1 quantile) for a dataset :param dataset: list of data :return: 1 quantile

maths.functions.quartile_50(dataset: list) → float[source]

Calculates median for a dataset :param dataset: list of data :return: 2 quantile (median value)

maths.functions.quartile_75(dataset: list) → float[source]

Calculates 25 quartile (1 quantile) for a dataset :param dataset: list of data :return: 3 quantile

maths.functions.skewness(dataset: list) → float[source]

Skewness[3] describes how far to the left or right a data set distribution is distorted from a symmetrical bell curve. A distribution with a long left tail is left-skewed, or negatively-skewed. A distribution with a long right tail is right-skewed, or positively-skewed.

Parameters

dataset – list of data

Returns

skewness coef (bias = False)

maths.functions.std(datalist: list) → float[source]

Returns standard deviation for a sample excluding NaNs

Parameters

datalist – list of values

Returns

standard deviation

maths.functions.sum_of_squares(dataset: list) → float[source]

The sum of squares is the sum of the squared differences between data values and the mean.

Parameters

dataset – list of data

Returns

sum of squares

maths.functions.sum_values(data: list) → float[source]

Returns the sum of not NaN values

Parameters

data – list of values

Returns

sum of values excluding NaN

maths.functions.var(dataset: list) → float[source]

Variance measures dispersion of data from the mean. The formula for variance is the sum of squared differences from the mean divided by the size of the data set.

Parameters

dataset – list of data

Returns

variance

Histogram program that helps to find similar distributions of classes among features

Creates a histogram plot showing distributions among classes for all features

pair plot

Piarplot program that shows pair scatter plots for all numeric features of a dataset

Finds most similar features using correlation matrix and draws a scatter plot for them
